text: Is there a way to infer from a Turing model if the likelihood is factorizable, i.e.  : `p(y|x) = \prod_i p(y|x_i)` ?

elements.text: Is there a way to infer from a Turing model if the likelihood is factorizable, i.e.  :

text: I don’t think there is one that works in general. But it would be great if we would have that in my opinion.

elements.text: I don’t think there is one that works in general. But it would be great if we would have that in my opinion.

text: Should be possible if the model is static, yeah. But I can't guaratee that AutoGibbs works with the newest Turing versions.
